member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.ClientsEventArgs.AvailableClients
member.summary: Access to the list of connected clients. This is a list of all applications no matter to which particular instrument they are connected.

member.summary: This will contain the original request passed to

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.CallResult.HasFinished

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.IExplorisAcquisition
member.summary: This interface describes the extensions to the acquisition interface by Exploris based instruments.

member.name: E:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.IExplorisAcquisition.AcquisitionStreamOpening
member.summary:
This event will be fired when a new acquisition is started and the system is about to open rawfiles, etc.
Scans may be created without an explicite acquisition if the instrument is 'just' set to running. An acquisition is not necessarily bound to a rawfile, but it is in most cases.
The individual information of a scan will reflect the information whether a scan belongs to an acquisition or not.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.IExplorisAcquisition.StartAcquisition(Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionWorkflow)
member.summary: Start an acquisition providing a workflow for this operation. The instrument must be on mode "On". There must not be any pending acquisition. The new acquisition will run under direct control.
member.param: workflow of the new acquisition.
member.exception: The connection to the instrument is not established.
The request is of an unknown type. Use to generate a valid type.
The instrument is under exclusive use of a different component or software package.
The instrument is not in the proper condition to accept the state change request.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.IExplorisAcquisition.CancelAcquisition
member.summary: Cancel any pending acquisition that is started under direct control.
member.exception: The connection to the instrument is not established.
The instrument is under exclusive use of a different component or software package.
The instrument is not in the proper condition to accept the state change request.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.IExplorisAcquisition.CreatePermanentAcquisition
member.summary:
Create an object that will instruct the instrument on to start an acquisition. This kind of acquisition can be paused and resumed.
The current set of tune data will be used. It can be changed during operation.
The instrument operation mode will switch to DirectControl.
The acquisition will be very similar to an acquisition started by Tune.
The acquisition can be stopped by calling .
member.returns: The created acquisition workflow can be used in .

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.IExplorisAcquisition.CreateAcquisitionLimitedByCount(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Create an object that will instruct the instrument on to start an acquisition. This kind of acquisition can be paused and resumed.
The current set of tune data will be used. It can be changed during operation.
The instrument operation mode will switch to DirectControl.
The acquisition can be stopped by calling and will implicitely terminated after the specified amount of scans have been taken.
The acquisition will be very similar to an acquisition started by Tune.
member.param: The number of scans to be taken during this acquisition. The number must be positive and must not exceed 1000000.
member.returns: The created acquisition workflow can be used in .

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.IExplorisAcquisition.CreateAcquisitionLimitedByDuration(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Create an object that will instruct the instrument on to start an acquisition. This kind of acquisition can be paused and resumed.
The current set of tune data will be used. It can be changed during operation.
The instrument operation mode will switch to DirectControl.
The acquisition can be stopped by calling and will implicitely terminated after the the specified time span has elapsed.
The acquisition will be very similar to an acquisition started by Tune.
member.param: The amount of time of the acquisition. The lower limit is 0.01 min and the maximum 15000 min.
member.returns: The created acquisition workflow can be used in .

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.IExplorisAcquisition.CreateMethodAcquisition(System.String)
member.summary:
Create an object that will instruct the instrument on to start a method-based acquisition. This kind of acquisition can be paused and resumed.
Tune data will be retrieved from those files present in the method.
The instrument operation mode will switch to DirectControl.
The acquisition can be stopped by calling and will implicitely terminated after the duration specified in the method has elapsed.
The acquisition will be very similar to an acquisition started by Xcalibur.
member.param: name of the method to execute.
member.returns: The created acquisition workflow can be used in .

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.IExplorisAcquisition.CreateMethodAcquisition(System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Create an object that will instruct the instrument on to start a method-based acquisition. This kind of acquisition can be paused and resumed.
Tune data will be retrieved from those files present in the method.
The instrument operation mode will switch to DirectControl.
The acquisition can be stopped by calling and will implicitely terminated after the the specified time span has elapsed.
The acquisition will be very similar to an acquisition started by Xcalibur.
member.param: name of the method to execute.
The amount of time of the acquisition. The lower limit is 0.01 min and the maximum 15000 min.
member.returns: The created acquisition workflow can be used in .

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace contains the extension to start acquisitions directly on Exploris based instruments.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.AcquisitionContinuation
member.summary: Defines what shall happen when an acquisition request ended.
member.remarks: See for an example how this enumeration can be used.

member.name: F:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.AcquisitionContinuation.StayOn
member.summary: The instrument will continue to run, but no method execution is performed nor is data written to a raw file.

member.name: F:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.AcquisitionContinuation.Standby
member.summary: The instrument enters the standby state.

member.name: F:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.AcquisitionContinuation.Off
member.summary: The instrument enters the off state.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionLimitedByCount
member.summary:
This special workflow restricts an acquisition to a specific count of scans to be taken by the instrument. Scans acquired using the interface are not counted.
The current tune parameters of the instrument will be used.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionLimitedByCount.NumberOfScans
member.summary: The number of scans to be taken during this acquisition. The number must be positive and must not exceed 1000000.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionLimitedByTime
member.summary:
This special workflow restricts an acquisition to a specific duration.
The current tune parameters of the instrument will be used.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionLimitedByTime.Duration
member.summary: Access to the duration of the acquisition. The lower limit is 0.01 min and the maximum 15000 min.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionMethodRun
member.summary:
This special workflow selects a method to be executed. No further instruments like AS, LC or GC will be driven. The duration of the method can be enhanced or reduced.
The tune parameters taken of the method's tune file(s) will be used.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionMethodRun.MethodName
member.summary: Access to the method name to be used during an acquisition.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionMethodRun.Duration
member.summary: Access to the duration of the acquisition. Setting this to null choses the duration chosen in the method itself. The lower limit is 0.01 min and the maximum 15000 min.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionWorkflow
member.summary: This workflow base class contains properties available in all acquisition workflows. Default values are "empty" for no rawfile acquisition, without sample name. etc. Continuation defaults to StayOn. WaitForContactClosure is false.

remarks.para: Note that no other device will be instructed to take scans.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionWorkflow.RawFileName
member.summary:
Access to the raw file name to be used during an acquisition. Setting this value to null lets the instrument take acquisitions without storing in a separate file.
An evaluation of this value will happen on submission to .

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionWorkflow.Continuation
member.summary: This property defines what shappens when the acquisition stops.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionWorkflow.SampleName
member.summary: This property defines the arbitrary sample name.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionWorkflow.Comment
member.summary: This property defines an arbitrary comment.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionWorkflow.SingleProcessingDelay
member.summary:
The instrument will not execute any scan if this property is positive until the delay has expired or a new custom scan has been defined.
It will be quaranteed that after the event no will be populated or written to the rawfile if this delay is pending and no custom scan has been placed.
The unit of this property is seconds and possible values are between 0 and 600 inclusively. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.IAcquisitionWorkflow.WaitForContactClosure
member.summary: This flag decides whether the instruments waits for contact closure signal before starting acquisition.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.Workflow.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace contains classes needed to start an acquisition on Exploris based instruments.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.ExplorisAcquisitionOpeningEventArgs
member.summary: This implementation of EventArgs carries additional information for analyzing binary data of scans later. The content can be used to write Foundation rawfiles.
member.para: An instance of this class will be created by .

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.ExplorisAcquisitionOpeningEventArgs.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new .

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Acquisition.ExplorisAcquisitionOpeningEventArgs.InitialDataBlock
member.summary: Access to the initial data block which can be deserialized using the assembly for deconvoluting Orbitrap-like formats. This information is needed to create rawfiles.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.IExplorisControl
member.summary: This interface describes the extensions to IControl by Exploris based instruments.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.IExplorisControl.InstrumentValues
member.summary:
Get access to the instrument values that can be accessed individually. The returned instance is helpful for status control and direct value manipulation.
A synchroneous change of several scan-related elements should better be performed using .
This property is the instrument-specific implementation for Exploris-based instruments.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.IExplorisControl.Acquisition
member.summary:
Get access to the acquisition interface.
This property is the instrument-specific implementation for Exploris-based instruments.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.IExplorisControl.LoadMethodEditor(System.Object)
member.summary:
Return an object to perform method editor operations. The interface should be used for method-based data acquisition and for method-based information access.
This method is accessible offline.
member.param: Parent element of the "data" storage
member.returns: The returned instance allows direct manipulation of a method. Method's content can be stored back to an IStorage interface or byte buffers. The user is responsible to dispose the object as soon as possible.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.IExplorisControl.LoadMethodEditor(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Return an object to perform method editor operations. The interface should be used for method-based data acquisition and for method-based information access.
This method is accessible offline.
member.param: content of the "data" storage
member.returns: The returned instance allows direct manipulation of a method. Method's content can be stored back to an IStorage interface or byte buffers. The user is responsible to dispose the object as soon as possible.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.InstrumentValues.IExplorisInstrumentValues
member.summary: This interface describes the extensions to IInstrumentValues by Exploris based instruments.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.InstrumentValues.IExplorisInstrumentValues.Get(System.String)
member.summary:
Get access to an instrument value by its name.
Each name has also a numeric representation, see .
This method is the instrument-specific implementation for Exploris-based instruments.
Accessing the same internal object twice just increments an internal reference, a further object will not be returned.
member.param: The name of the value
member.returns: null is returned for an invalid or unknown name, otherwise the value linked with the passed name is returned.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.InstrumentValues.IExplorisInstrumentValues.Get(System.UInt64)
member.summary:
Get access to an instrument value by its number.
This method is the instrument-specific implementation for Exploris-based instruments.
member.remarks: Accessing the same internal object twice just increments an internal reference, a further object will not be returned.
member.param: The number of the value
member.returns: The value linked with the passed name is returned. Nodes unknown to the instrument may return in a dumb value instance.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.InstrumentValues.IExplorisValue
member.summary: This interface describes the extensions to an instrument value by Exploris based instruments.
member.example: A full-file example can be found here: .

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.InstrumentValues.IExplorisValue.Commands
member.summary:
Get access to a list of available commands. The list may change if the user role changes. Any executed command name will be tested against this list.
The commands will be null if the instrument is not connected or if the IValue is unknown to the instrument.

member.name: E:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.InstrumentValues.IExplorisValue.CommandsChanged
member.summary: This event will be fired when the set of commands have changed. The calling thread should not be blocked by complex actions.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.InstrumentValues.IExplorisValue.Execute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a command on this value. The command will be verified using .
member.param: The command to the value.
null or the argument of the command.
member.returns: true if the command has been sent to the instrument, false otherwise

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.InstrumentValues.IExplorisValue.RequestCommands
member.summary: Request a fresh set of . Those values will be updated asynchroneously. will be fired on demand.
member.returns: true if the command has been sent to the instrument, false otherwise

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.InstrumentValues.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
This namespace covers the single extension that Exploris-based instruments have in addition to standard instruments' value control. Some Set/Readback values nodes allow to perform additional actions on Exploris based instruments.
You can simply cast an
to an
on an Exploris based instrument.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Methods.IMethodEditor
member.summary:
This interface provides functionality to access the method editor elements and to perform some actions on the method editor elements.
No content will be written on disposal, that needs to be done previously by use of the Store() methods.
This interface is accessible offline.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Methods.IMethodEditor.Store(System.Object,System.String[0:,0:]@)
member.summary:
Store the current content of the method to the destination. Exceptions will be thrown on error.
Storing of incomplete methods are allowed, but storing of invalid methods are not. See properties and to retrieve these information items in advance.
Calling this method successfully voids the current set of CFR21 records.
This method is accessible offline.
member.param: Parent element of the "data" and "text" storage
This will be the set of CFR21 records explaining all changes since loading or the last store operation.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Methods.IMethodEditor.Store(System.Byte[]@,System.Byte[]@,System.String[0:,0:]@)
member.summary:
Store the current content of the method to the byte buffers. Exceptions will be thrown on error.
Storing of incomplete methods are allowed, but storing of invalid methods are not. See properties and to retrieve these information items in advance.
Calling this method successfully voids the current set of CFR21 records.
This method is accessible offline.
member.param: new content of the "data" storage
new content of the "text" storage
This will be the set of CFR21 records explaining all changes since loading or the last store operation.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Methods.IMethodEditor.Warnings
member.summary:
Get access to all warning messages about the method. This includes missing elements.
Calls to the Store methods will be processed if warnings are present. But see also .
This property is accessible offline.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Methods.IMethodEditor.Errors
member.summary:
Get access to all error messages about the method. This typically indicates values that are incompatible or external files that are missing.
Calls to the Store methods will throw exceptions if errors are present.
This property is accessible offline.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Methods.IMethodEditor.Modified
member.summary: Returns true if the method has been modified.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Methods.IMethodEditor.LoadTable(System.Type,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Get the content of the selected table. Changes in the table will not cause any change in the original method editor. A call to is needed.
This method is accessible offline.
member.param: Type of the table which has to derive from ITable like IInclusionTable
Index of the table starting from 1. Keep this on 1 in case of doubt.
member.returns: null if the table was not found, otherwise the table filled with found items.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Methods.IMethodEditor.StoreTable(Thermo.Interfaces.InstrumentAccess_V1.Control.Methods.ITable,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Replace the table in the method editor by that one in the argument.
This method is accessible offline.
member.param: Table which has to derive from ITable like IInclusionTable, the content replaces a table in the method editor.
Index of the table starting from 1. Keep this on 1 in case of doubt.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Methods.IMethodEditor.GetGlobalValueNames
member.summary: Return all global value names. One can use the methods and to access individual values.
member.returns: The returned strings represent accessible global properties.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Methods.IMethodEditor.GetGlobalValueName(System.String,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Return the representation of a global value name exposed to users in a specific locale.
member.param: name returned by
culture for which a to return a UI representation of the name
member.returns: The returned string can be used in UIs to present end users a known value name.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Methods.IMethodEditor.GetGlobalValue(System.String,System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter@)
member.summary: Return the content of a global value. The also returned type converter can be used to translate the returned object into a human readable string.
member.param: name returned by
The converter which can be used to translate the returned object into a UI string or which can be used to prepare a UI string to be passed back by
member.returns: The returned object is the value associated with the specified name. null may be a possible value.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Methods.IMethodEditor.SetGlobalValue(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Set the content of a global value.
member.param: name returned by
New value of the name. The converter returned by can be used for easy manipulation.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Methods.IMethodEditor.GetGlobalValueHelp(System.String,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Return help for a global value exposed to users in a specific locale. The return value may be the empty string.
member.param: name returned by
culture for which a to return the help
member.returns: The returned string can be used in UIs to present end users some help about a value. The string may be the empty string.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.Methods.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
This namespace covers the single extension that Exploris-based instruments have in addition to standard instruments' methods.
You can simply cast an .

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.Control.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
This namespace covers the extensions that Exploris-based instruments have in addition to standard instruments. Exploris based systems have support for tunefiles where a bunch of optimized instrument values are stored that usually be constant during an acquisition.
You can simply cast an
to an
on an Exploris based instrument.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccess
member.summary: This interface extends the standard instrument access interface by functionality present in Exploris based instruments.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccess.GetMsScanContainer(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Get access to the container of MS scan information to be accessible by a a specific MS detector set.
This property is the instrument-specific implementation for Exploris-based instruments.
member.param: index of the detector starting from 0
member.returns: Returns a particular mass spectrometer detector set or null if a detector with the specific index is not present in the instrument.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccess.Control
member.summary:
Get access to the interface covering all control functionality of an instrument.
This property is the instrument-specific implementation for Exploris-based instruments.
This property is accessible offline.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccess.CurrentUserRole
member.summary: Access to the current user role the system has assumed. On set, an Exception will be thrown if the instrument is not connected or if the intended user role is not available.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccess.Licenses
member.summary: Get access to all currently useable licenses.

member.name: E:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccess.CurrentUserRoleChanged
member.summary: This event will be fired when the has changed.

member.name: E:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccess.LicensesChanged
member.summary: This event will be fired when the set of licenses for this instrument or the API consuming assemblies changed.

member.name: E:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccess.ConfigurationChanged
member.summary:
This event will be fired when the configuration of the instrument changed.
Appropriate action can be to restart the connection or to flush all caches.

member.name: E:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccess.LockChanged
member.summary: The lock state of the instrument has changed. This may disable some functionality or re-enables access to it.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccessContainer
member.summary: This interface extends the standard API by functionality most probably specific to Exploris-based instruments. The example of accessing can also be used to access this interface, with the appropriate cast, of course.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccessContainer.Get(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get access to a particular Exploris instrument accessor using this method.
member.param: Index of the instrument starting from 1. Values of 2 or more need additional instruments attached to the data system.
member.returns: The return value allows access to a particular instrument. If one service hosts several instruments in parallel, this value can be of a different type for each. Any call to will return the same instance.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccessContainer.ReceiveNonGlobalMessages
member.summary:
This flag allows to receive messages which have been generated by the connection service or the instrument and which are intended for internal use only.
See also

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccessContainer.ReceiveApiDebugMessages
member.summary:
This flag allows to receive messages which have been generated by the API itself or its communication layer and which are intended for internal use only.
See also

member.name: E:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccessContainer.InstrumentClientStateChanged
member.summary: This event will be fired when the list of clients change which interact with the Exploris system.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccessContainer.GetClients
member.summary: Get the list of active clients without the currently calling client.
member.returns: Returns the list of clients to the Exploris system without the current instance.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccessContainer.GetInstrumentIds
member.summary: Get the list of active instruments hosted by the service.
member.returns: Returns the list of instrument IDs hosted by the connected service.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccessContainer.Call(System.Object)
member.summary:
This method can be used to call the inner parts of the system directly. The functionality is determined by the argument , which has to fulfil some conditions.
The functionality may be executed synchronously or asynchronously. During execution, an exception may occur. When called asynchronously, the access of the result in the return vallue will throw an exception.
member.param: Command or request to be executed by the core of the driver.
member.returns:
The return value will have the flag set if the called ended synchronously. The actual result is placed in .
An asynchronous execution will fire after the result is available. The argument to the handler will contain the same ICallResult as returned here. Use either this instance or to identify the original request.
member.exception: The argument does not fit the demands.

member.name: E:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisInstrumentAccessContainer.AsyncResult
member.summary:
This handler will be executed when the result of an asynchronous execution of becomes available.
Either the ICallResult or can be used for finding the proper request if more than one is outstanding.
Accessing may throw an exception if during processing of the request an exception occured.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisLicenseInfo
member.summary: This interface describes a single license used in the Exploris system.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisLicenseInfo.License
member.summary: Get access to the full license text from which everything else in this class is extracted except of . For temporary licenses, this will be the empty string.

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisLicenseInfo.Target
member.summary: Get access to the instrument id, usually a 12-digit hexadecimal number or the identification of an assembly, but it can be the empty string to address all instruments. The value is null for an invalid license (see ).

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisLicenseInfo.ExpirationTime
member.summary: Get access to the expiration time of the license in local time. The value is DateTime.MinValue for an invalid license (see ).

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisLicenseInfo.Emitter
member.summary: Get access to the emitter of the license. The value is null for an invalid license (see ).

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisLicenseInfo.TargetSoftwareFamily
member.summary: Get access to the target software system that has to be matched or the empty string if that does not matter. Example: "Exploris" for all Exploris Series instruments. The value is null for an invalid license (see ).

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisLicenseInfo.TargetSoftwareVersion
member.summary: Get access to the target software version to match with abbreviations. "2" equals to major version 2, "2.1" for also addressing minor version 1, etc. The value is null for an invalid license (see ).

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisLicenseInfo.Features
member.summary: Get access to all features or user roles granted by this licenses. The value is null for an invalid license (see ).

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisLicenseInfo.AppliedExpirationTime
member.summary: Get access to the expiration time of the license in local time or, if coming from a removed flash drive, when the tolerance time expires. The value is DateTime.MinValue for an invalid license (see ).

member.name: P:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.IExplorisLicenseInfo.Flags
member.summary: Get access to the description about the license.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.ExplorisLicenseClassifier
member.summary: A license classifiers returns information about a particular license.

member.name: F:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.ExplorisLicenseClassifier.Illegal
member.summary: The license string could not be recognized as a license.

member.name: F:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.ExplorisLicenseClassifier.Valid
member.summary: The given license string is a valid license (but may be outdated or not applicable)

member.name: F:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.ExplorisLicenseClassifier.Expired
member.summary: This license already has expired

member.name: F:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.ExplorisLicenseClassifier.AddressesAssembly
member.summary: If set, the license is dedicated to an assembly. , and this flag are mutually exclusive.

member.name: F:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.ExplorisLicenseClassifier.AddressesOneInstrumentOnly
member.summary: If set, the license is dedicated to a particular instrument. , and this flag are mutually exclusive.

member.name: F:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.ExplorisLicenseClassifier.AddressesMultipleInstruments
member.summary: If set, the license is addressing all instruments. , and this flag are mutually exclusive.

member.name: F:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.ExplorisLicenseClassifier.Temporary
member.summary: If set, the license is not stored on disk and will not be stored.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.MsScanContainer.IExplorisMsScan
member.summary:
This interface describes the extensions to an instrument value by Exploris based instruments.
The Clone() operation will be a shallow one, although a separate call to Dispose() will be required for the clone.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.MsScanContainer.IExplorisMsScan.GetSpectrum(System.IntPtr@,System.Int64@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get access to the spectrum binary data
member.param: The binary blob with spectrum data.
Size of the data
Identifies the type of the spectrum data. It is identical to numbering used in FileIO.
member.returns: The method returns true when the information is available, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Information taken from this call must not be used after disposing .

Size of the data
member.returns: The method returns true when the information is available, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Information taken from this call must not be used after disposing .

Size of the data

member.summary: Get access to the error log.
member.param: The error log information as string.
member.returns: The method returns true when the information is available, otherwise false.

member.name: T:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.MsScanContainer.IExplorisMsScanContainer
member.summary: This interface describes the extensions to IMsScanContainer by Exploris based instruments.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.MsScanContainer.IExplorisMsScanContainer.GetLastMsScan
member.summary:
Get access to the last scan seen in the system. The value can be null initially.
Note that accessing this property forces the consumer to dispose the item as soon as possible in order to free its shared memory resources.
member.returns: The method returns the latest scan the framework is aware off. It may be null. It is castable to an Thermo.Interfaces.InstrumentAccess_V1.MsScanContainer.IMsScan

member.name: E:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.MsScanContainer.IExplorisMsScanContainer.MsScanArrived
member.summary:
This event will be fired when a new scan has been emitted by the instrument.
Any listener to this event must handle the event as fast as possible. It is good practice by analyzing tool to enqueue the scan into queue and process that queue in another thread.

member.name: M:Thermo.Interfaces.ExplorisAccess_V1.MsScanContainer.ExplorisMsScanEventArgs.GetExplorisScan
member.summary:
Get the scan that has just arrived from the instrument. It has replaced already the LastScan in the .
Note that accessing this method forces the consumer to dispose the item as soon as possible in order to free its shared memory resources.
member.returns: The method returns the scan data of a scan event. It is castable to an Thermo.Interfaces.InstrumentAccess_V1.MsScanContainer.IMsScan
